member.name: IDXGISurface1.GetDC
member.summary: Returns a device context (DC) that allows you to render to a Microsoft DirectX Graphics Infrastructure (DXGI) surface using Windows Graphics Device Interface (GDI).
member.param: A Boolean value that specifies whether to preserve Direct3D contents in the GDI DC. TRUE directs the runtime not to preserve Direct3D contents in the GDI DC; that is, the runtime discards the Direct3D contents. FALSE guarantees that Direct3D contents are available in the GDI DC.
A pointer to an HDC handle that represents the current device context for GDI rendering.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful; otherwise, an error code.

member.name: IDXGISurface1.ReleaseDC
member.summary: Releases the GDI device context (DC) that is associated with the current surface and allows you to use Direct3D to render.

param.name: pDirtyRect
param.para:
A pointer to a RECT structure that identifies the dirty region of the surface.
A dirty region is any part of the surface that you used for GDI rendering and that you want to preserve. This area is used as a performance hint to graphics subsystem in certain scenarios. Do not use this parameter to restrict rendering to the specified rectangular region. If you pass in NULL, ReleaseDC considers the whole surface as dirty. Otherwise, ReleaseDC uses the area specified by the RECT as a performance hint to indicate what areas have been manipulated by GDI rendering.
You can pass a pointer to an empty RECT structure (a rectangle with no position or area) if you didn't change any content.

member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IDXGISurface1
member.summary: The IDXGISurface1 interface extends the by adding support for using Windows Graphics Device Interface (GDI) to render to a Microsoft DirectX Graphics Infrastructure (DXGI) surface.
